definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: When she last saw him, he was a sad ─old and tired.
sentences.chinese: 她上次見到他時，他一副慘兮兮的樣子蒼老而疲憊。

sentences.english: Sea LanZhu coma lying in bed, defends huang taiji in the bedside old a lot.
sentences.chinese: 海蘭珠一直昏迷躺在牀上，皇太極守在牀邊蒼老不少。

sentences.english: As time moved on, he looked much older than before.
sentences.chinese: 隨着歲月的流逝，他顯得蒼老多了。

sentences.english: Wait, is the original hoary life.
sentences.chinese: 等候，是終生最初的蒼老。

sentences.english: Many of them cried, and with dried old hands wiped away their tears.
sentences.chinese: 很多人哭了，用蒼老的手抹去眼淚。

sentences.english: Yuehua Jian, I saw my grandmother's face had aged they have a few wrinkles.
sentences.chinese: 說話間，我看見了奶奶蒼老的臉上又添了幾條皺紋。

sentences.english: So old and firm they scarcely show the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 它們那樣蒼老堅定幾乎密不透風。

sentences.english: A simple and honest old voice.
sentences.chinese: 一個憨厚蒼老的聲音傳來。

sentences.english: Love often is not enough time to light, but heart is old.
sentences.chinese: 很多時候愛情還沒來得及淡卻，而心已經蒼老。

sentences.english: A city spell-bound under the aging sun.
sentences.chinese: 蒼老的日頭下整座城都被魔咒封鎖。

sentences.english: It is a grand old face that bespeaks suffering but not defeat.
sentences.chinese: 這是一張帶着忍受而非屈服的高貴而蒼老的面孔。

sentences.english: His father is standing off to one side, he has grown old.
sentences.chinese: 他的父親遠遠的站在另一邊，已經蒼老了。

sentences.english: "Strip off the trousers, " he said, and you were really startled. The old man laughed as a naïve child.
sentences.chinese: 聽了還真令你愣住，他嗓音蒼老卻笑得像孩童般天真。

sentences.english: Life's tragedy is that we get old to soon and wise too late.
sentences.chinese: 生命昀悲劇在於莪們蒼老昀太快卻聰明昀太慢。

sentences.english: Sends the violet recollection to receive is actually the years old satire.
sentences.chinese: 寄走堇色回憶收到的卻是歲月蒼老的諷刺。

sentences.english: “Just a minute”, answered a frail, elderly voice.
sentences.chinese: “等一會兒”，一個羸弱而蒼老的聲音回答道。

definition: to remain silent/to have nothing to say/(coll.) speechless/dumbfounded
